titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wholesale Jewelry Catalogs, 1966-1995 RL.11133
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-02-26 11:19:32 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Trade catalogs of jewelry prepared for individual local retail stores.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Wholesale Jewelry Catalogs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1996.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Wholesale Jewelry Catalogs, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections: J. Walter Thompson Company. Diamond Information Center Vertical Files; Jeffery Collection of Diamond Promotional Materials.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection spans 1966-1995 and includes direct-mail jewelry catalogs, print proofs, flyers and newspaper inserts that advertised jewelry sold in local stores. Companies represented include Anson, Inc. of Providence, R.I., Norvell-Marcum Co. of Tulsa, Okla. and the Jewelers of America trade organization. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
